website_summaries.verdict: A basic hydration solution that’s both ultra-comfortable and well insulated.
pros: Ergonomic bottle shape reduces the risk of hand cramping
Small expandable pocket doesn’t get in the way but is big enough to hold necessities
cons: A few users complained of a prominent plastic aftertaste for first few uses

customer_reviews.title: If you have to carry water on a run , this works well.
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size for my 15-20 mile runs. I keep a couple energy gels in the pocket too. I like the squeeze to get water out feature, so I don't have to fiddle with any lids or locks. I don't really like carrying something while I run, but so far this is the least annoying!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good bottle, not insulated tho
customer_reviews.text: Good bottle, fits awesome in the hand and does not move around at all. I would NOT say that it is thermally insulated........ at least not very well. I can fill it full to the top with ice and the rest with water and the water is no longer cold by mile 3. I know that might be too critical but they put it in the title which made me feel like I was mislead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This runners bottle is easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have run 50 marathons in the last decade. I use a run/walk method popularized by Galloway. I prefer to carry my water. The Amphipod bottle has an ergonomic shape the makes it easy to carry. Your hand slips behind the cover so you have to grip it hard. The large opening is especially beneficial. When I need to refill at a water stop, I can open it as I approach and easily get it refilled. I take it with me on all my practice runs. It’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher N Lee

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Bottle
customer_reviews.text: I finally found the perfect running water bottle. Just pay attention to the size you are ordering. I accidentally ordered the 20oz, then ended up ordering the 16oz which is perfect for races. I use this 20oz one for long runs...
customer_reviews.author: andy1lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good hydration bottle, but cover is not good.
customer_reviews.text: Great for my Summer morning runs, long or short. Good grip in my hand, pocket holds my mp3 player nicely. I have three with the older cover; I like this one because it's easier to remove and reinstall after washing. A little pricey, but I keep buying them. 🤷🏾‍♀️ Update, 8/18/2020: after only three uses, cover has a hole in it. Does not stand up to washing like the others. Disappointed; won't buy another one. Rating changed to two stars.
customer_reviews.author: A. F. SLATER

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Perfect for short hot runs.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a water bottle for running in Florida summers and this one was well reivewed. I was worried about holding it, but you get used to it. Leaks a bit if top isn't on just so, likely user error. I like it a lot, tho I wish it was insulated and also that you could see how far the water is up when filling. Still...5 stars for me.
customer_reviews.author: Liz from Vermont, now in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Useless, unusable, waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the worst product I've ever bought on Amazon. I'd give 0 stars if possible. Horrible plastic smell and taste. Tried several uses, soak in vinegar and washing in dishwasher in the hope it would dissipate.... nope. After taking skin off for dishwasher the handle will no longer stay attached.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Haddad

customer_reviews.title: Best water bottle to run with
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite water bottles for running. We always have 3 or 4 in rotation. We have several other brands that I gave away because these are by far the most comfortable to hold. Beats a hydration pack for running in heat.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Burton

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hold but leaks around cap even well secured. Also mouth spout leaks in any position and there isn’t an indicator to show it is “closed”(like a color change to indicate). Keeps water cool but not cold.
customer_reviews.author: Mythoughts

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but could be built better
customer_reviews.text: The pouch is really small, barely capable of holding credit card and car keys. The lower rubber strap got disconnected after less than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: O. Nissan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect in my hand and holds enough water for my daily run. The pocket is great to carry my ID or credit card if I plan on stopping some place. Recommend it to anyone for any sport.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Amphipod is great! This is my second hand held water bottle ...
customer_reviews.text: Amphipod is great! This is my second hand held water bottle and they are comfortable and carry a great amount of water for moderate runs. They are comfortable in your hand, the neoprene keep your hand dry and your water cool! I love their products!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Too warm for summer running but other than that it’s great.
customer_reviews.text: This product was a little warm for my summer running, but that is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over priced
customer_reviews.text: Great size, comfortable strap. Just seems so over priced for bottom line a "Plastic Bottle"
customer_reviews.author: jcf123

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works great for its intended purpose the plastic bottle is starting to discolor and its only used for water.
customer_reviews.author: Poison967

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for runners
customer_reviews.text: I used this to run a full marathon with. I never had to stop at a water station through the whole event. This was the only thing I carried. Was very light and portable- would highly recommend it for runners.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Apple

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I had a Camelbak prior to this one and it got really uncomfortable after a couple miles into my run. The strap would also loosen up. I went on a 12 mile run today and this Amphipod was really comfortable in my hand and the strap stayed nice and tight. The pocket was also big enough to hold 2 gels. I’m sure I could have shoved a third one. No leaks.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Best water bottle!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good things! So easy to hold and drunk out of while running. I was worried because I've never been able to hold anything while running without getting a cramp, but this water bottle is so comfortable and easy to hold!
customer_reviews.author: JessB

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy ever
customer_reviews.text: Best Buy ever! Holds a perfect amount of liquid for a good hours worth of activity. You can dishwasher on the top shelf without need to remove the neoprene sleeve. Love this bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Shop1

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I like it a lot. But for $30 it’s a little spendy. But it’s the best one that I’ve found
customer_reviews.author: Carl Abushakrah

customer_reviews.title: ... first handheld purchase as I usually use a hydration best. I like the feel and how easy it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is/ was my first handheld purchase as I usually use a hydration best. I like the feel and how easy it is to drink from, however, the bottom tab would slide off almost everytime I would switch hands. This was very frustrating as I was running a 50 mile race and after so many hours the smallest thing can annoy you.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Best handheld water bottle I have owned so far. Comfortable and doesn’t leak. Love that it’s reflective too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bottle! It makes it really easy to run and hike and not worry about holding it as it just stays in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Tonja Pichardo

customer_reviews.title: Good size for a medium distance run.
customer_reviews.text: I like this water bottle and I also have the one with the less elaborate strap. My only issue with this is occasionally when I switch hands while running the bottom strap comes off. It's not ideal to put back on while running, but still a good product overall. I may glue it to the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: FishersFrank

customer_reviews.title: Great size and perfect for long runs.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Very happy with this. The carrier will start to smell after a weeks work of jogs but just throw it in the wash each week.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Leaky Cap
customer_reviews.text: Bought a replacement amphipod handheld water bottle and not happy. The cap design leaks around the outside of the nozzle causing sports drink to spray out everywhere when the bottle is squeezed not just through the mouth piece.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B.

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I had an older one that I lost and replaced it with this. The new valve is a great improvement. The zipper pocket is perfect for a house or car key.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lightfoot

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Water Bottle
customer_reviews.text: Great product and extremely functional. Like any new water bottle, takes a run or two to get used to but it's a great size, weight, and design for a running water bottle
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is great, it doesn’t move at all while I’m running.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable. Will hold keys.
customer_reviews.text: Had one for 5 - 7 years of training for about 15 marathons. The bite-valve broke. I see the new one has a new bite-valve design that addresses the failure. Comfortable to hold. Will hold key and fob.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T. Blake

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and holds enough water for about half marathon distances
customer_reviews.text: 2nd bottle, used 1st for about seven years and never had any issues. Comfortable and holds enough water for about half marathon distances. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: peter frank

customer_reviews.title: Defective item I guess, the cap doesn't screw on
customer_reviews.text: I screw the cap on and it just pops right off. It's 100% completely unusable. Assuming I just got a dud
customer_reviews.author: jwhat

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and Great Construction!
customer_reviews.text: Amphipod is my favorite running bottle. The foam case that goes around the bottle makes for a comfortable grip. The band that wraps the bottle is snug and does not slip. Haven’t had the bottle leak at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is heavy when full of liquid. Does not ...
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy when full of liquid. Does not keep anything cold and often awkward to hold in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Athletic gal

customer_reviews.title: Functional and Comfy to hold!
customer_reviews.text: Great for a long run, easy to hold and comfortable. Doesn’t keep water very cold but that’s not important to me.
customer_reviews.author: jillien

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best running bottle I have, and I have tried many! Does not leak, ergonomic fit, light.
customer_reviews.author: IAM

customer_reviews.title: Room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Removing the bottle from the harness for cleaning and putting it back in could be easier.
customer_reviews.author: Trail Guy

customer_reviews.title: Best running water bottle hands down
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down my favorite running water bottle. I tried to switch to Camelbak, but this one is far superior. It’s comfortable, light weight, and not clunky. I’ll be buying this from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love their products. This is my second running water bottle from them.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Discolored, Smelled like hot melting plastic.
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all. Threw away after less than one month.
customer_reviews.author: erin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: My go to hydration for moderate runs. Easy to hold. The new lid does leak if you squeeze while running...
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Stranske

customer_reviews.title: Works GREA!!!!T
customer_reviews.text: It did exactly what I needed it to do on my run leg of a Triathlon. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Williams

customer_reviews.title: This product is not as advertised. It is advertised ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is not as advertised. It is advertised as being 20 oz thermal water bottle, it only holds 16.9 oz. A little disappointing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to hold and fairly big to have enough water for my runs
customer_reviews.author: Johana Rico

customer_reviews.title: Great product! The most comfortable product to run long ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! The most comfortable product to run long distances with. Lightweight and I don't have to use my grip because the strap does it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Collins

customer_reviews.title: It could be great but it doesn't seal well
customer_reviews.text: It could be great but it doesn't seal well, water is always leaking out the lid where it screws on.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Handheld bottle only holds 15.8 ounces not the 20 it says.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great water or sports drink bottle for long distances
customer_reviews.text: This is a great water or sports drink bottle for long distances. It really does hold 20 oz and conforms to your hand so that it is not bothersome to carry. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: ANNA LIVENGOOD

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit iPhone 6 or later
customer_reviews.text: The pouch probably fits a iPhone 5s, but no longer any of the new sizes. Also, the handle slips off after a little while, but other than that a great product.
customer_reviews.author: AkD

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine during training but fell apart during my marathon, when I needed it the most
customer_reviews.author: Keith Long

product_meta.title: Amphipod Hydraform Jett-Lite Thermal Insulated Handheld Hydartion
product_meta.description: A top-rated choice by recreational marathon and ultrarunners! From training for a marathon to filling the basic fluid carrying requirements of your running club, Hydraform Handheld bottles are designed to allow even the minimalist to bring fluid and basic essentials. Zipper pocket fits: keys, cards/ID, gel, phone and/or other small basic essentials
feature_bullets: Ultra-minimalist design with ergonomically contoured bottle to eliminate hand cramping; BPA-Free
New Jett-Squeeze cap for quick hydration
Breathable and removable thermal sleeve is hand washable
Quick-grab zipper pull; Expandable zippered pocket fits phone, nutrition, keys; Reflective pocket detail
Cushioned, adjustable hand strap with no-slip bottom strap
